author: holiman
content: The term "veto" means "I forbid" in Latin. It does not convey the same thing as "we will object to". It literally means that you have the authority to unilaterally forbid something, and that you plan to use that authority. I'm not trying to split hairs here, I think the distinction is important. I think it's totally fine to say "we (as a team, or me as an individual) are opposed to X and will do all we can to have it rejected".

author: holiman
content: I've seen no evidence of DoS-attack research from the "general public" of node operators. Secondly, yeah, I'm not really arguing in favour of forcing, but rather against the notion that "node operators knows best" (because I believe it's easy to think all is good as long as nothing bad happens. Which IMO was the case before the shanghai dos attacks)

author: protolambda
content: The Merge API is not user-facing, it's meant for a beacon-node (or maybe L2 node) to change forkchoice and insert blocks. This is exposed on a different connection, does not have to be part of web3js (if you want to contribute bindings for tools/testing that's nice, but it can be separate, as you wouldn't use it in something like metamask). The "engine" namespace was proposed in the design doc (since "consensus" or "pos" is confusing since we have a beacon node with its own API, and rollups/others may want to use this engine too).
